alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 1:50PM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River near Harlem affecting Blaine County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will keep the river flowing high. Expect minor flooding downstream from Fresno dam. For the Milk River...including Harlem...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Milk River near Harlem. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, At 21 Feet...the Milk River near Harlem is bankfull. Some minor problems can occur near/along the river from Chinook to east of Harlem. Impacts start to go up quickly as the stage goes above 21 feet. (March 2017) Notes: In April 2018, river at Harlem was 24 feet, and the flooding came from 30 Mile Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM MDT Sunday the stage was 21.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:30 PM MDT Sunday was 23.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 21.4 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.5 feet on 05/11/1975. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Milk River Harlem 21.0 21.4 Sun 12 pm MD 19.9 20.2 20.8 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM MDT.
